trans-unit.source: Under the Occlusion properties, you can set an occlusion map. This is the default occlusion attribute. The occlusion map use geometry occlusion information baked into a texture to modulate the ambient and direct lighting.
trans-unit.target: Under the Occlusion properties, you can set an occlusion map. This is the default occlusion attribute. The occlusion map use geometry occlusion information baked into a texture to modulate the ambient and direct lighting.

trans-unit.source: The screenshots below demonstrate the use of occlusion maps and cavity maps:
trans-unit.target: The screenshots below demonstrate the use of occlusion maps and cavity maps:

trans-unit.source: Coarse occlusion of the ambient light
trans-unit.target: Coarse occlusion of the ambient light

trans-unit.source: The occlusion map scalar provider that determines how much ambient light is accessible on the material. A value of 1.0 means that the material is fully lit by ambient lighting. A value of 0.0 means that the material is not lighted by the ambient lighting
trans-unit.target: The occlusion map scalar provider that determines how much ambient light is accessible on the material. A value of 1.0 means that the material is fully lit by ambient lighting. A value of 0.0 means that the material is not lighted by the ambient lighting

trans-unit.source: Applies to Occlusion Map and influences direct lighting
trans-unit.target: Applies to Occlusion Map and influences direct lighting

trans-unit.source: The cavity map scalar provider is multiplied with direct lighting. It lets you define very fine grained cavity where direct light can't enter. The cavity map is usually defined for thin concave cavity
trans-unit.target: The cavity map scalar provider is multiplied with direct lighting. It lets you define very fine grained cavity where direct light can't enter. The cavity map is usually defined for thin concave cavity

trans-unit.source: A factor for diffuse lighting influence of the cavity map. A value of 1.0 means the cavity map fully influences the diffuse lighting
trans-unit.target: A factor for diffuse lighting influence of the cavity map. A value of 1.0 means the cavity map fully influences the diffuse lighting

trans-unit.source: A factor for specular lighting influence of the cavity map. A value of 1.0 means the cavity map fully influences the specular lighting
trans-unit.target: A factor for specular lighting influence of the cavity map. A value of 1.0 means the cavity map fully influences the specular lighting

trans-unit.source: Under the Transparency properties, you can specify values that change the transparency of the material. You can coose Blend, Additive, or Cutoff.
trans-unit.target: Under the Transparency properties, you can specify values that change the transparency of the material. You can coose Blend, Additive, or Cutoff.

trans-unit.source: The additive transparency takes into account the diffuse and diffuse/emissive alpha.
trans-unit.target: The additive transparency takes into account the diffuse and diffuse/emissive alpha.

trans-unit.source: If the Alpha property is less than 0.5, only the specular highlights are visible. The material itself is completely invisible.
trans-unit.target: If the Alpha property is less than 0.5, only the specular highlights are visible. The material itself is completely invisible.

trans-unit.source: We only see the specular highlight in additive mode
trans-unit.target: We only see the specular highlight in additive mode

trans-unit.source: Transparency is fully additive. Specular highlights at maximum
trans-unit.target: Transparency is fully additive. Specular highlights at maximum

trans-unit.source: If the Alpha <= 1.0, the material is semi-opaque with the diffuse/emissive component. If the diffuse component has an alpha, it's transparent.
trans-unit.target: If the Alpha <= 1.0, the material is semi-opaque with the diffuse/emissive component. If the diffuse component has an alpha, it's transparent.

trans-unit.source: Specular highlights, diffuse with alpha and semi-opaque diffuse
trans-unit.target: Specular highlights, diffuse with alpha and semi-opaque diffuse

trans-unit.source: Specular highlights, diffuse with alpha and opaque diffuse
trans-unit.target: Specular highlights, diffuse with alpha and opaque diffuse

trans-unit.source: The alpha value is interpreted like this:
trans-unit.target: The alpha value is interpreted like this:

trans-unit.source: Alpha <= 0.5, the material is rendered in additive mode without the diffuse component (only specular highlights)
trans-unit.target: Alpha <= 0.5, the material is rendered in additive mode without the diffuse component (only specular highlights)

trans-unit.source: Alpha <= 1.0, the material is rendered in semi-opaque mode with the diffuse/emissive component. If the diffuse component has an alpha, it's displayed as transparent
trans-unit.target: Alpha <= 1.0, the material is rendered in semi-opaque mode with the diffuse/emissive component. If the diffuse component has an alpha, it's displayed as transparent

trans-unit.source: Apply a color tint to the transparency layer
trans-unit.target: Apply a color tint to the transparency layer

trans-unit.source: Renders a material when the current alpha color is above the threshold you specify with the Alpha slider.
trans-unit.target: Renders a material when the current alpha color is above the threshold you specify with the Alpha slider.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshots show the influence of the cutoff Alpha value.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshots show the influence of the cutoff Alpha value.

trans-unit.source: Clear-coat shading uses physically-based rendering to simulate vehicle paint.
trans-unit.target: Clear-coat shading uses physically-based rendering to simulate vehicle paint.
